meanings.definition: Showy but cheap and of poor quality.
meanings.sent1: The tawdry necklace she bought at the dollar store broke after one wear.
meanings.sent2: The tawdry decorations at the party clashed with the elegant theme.
meanings.sent3: Her tawdry attempt at DIY jewelry ended up looking like a child's art project.
meanings.sent4: The tawdry display of wealth only served to highlight his lack of taste.
meanings.sent5: The tawdry painting hung crookedly on the wall, drawing attention for all the wrong reasons.

meanings.sent1: The tawdry dress she wore to the event was covered in sequins and glitter.
meanings.sent2: The tawdry car parked in front of the mansion screamed for attention.
meanings.sent3: His tawdry choice of outfit made him stand out like a sore thumb.
meanings.sent4: The tawdry display of lights on the building made it visible from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The tawdry sign outside the store was impossible to miss, even from a distance.

meanings.sent1: The tawdry furniture in the waiting room clashed with the modern decor.
meanings.sent2: Her tawdry accessories made her outfit look mismatched.
meanings.sent3: The tawdry wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling at the edges.
meanings.sent4: The tawdry music blaring from the speakers was giving everyone a headache.
meanings.sent5: The tawdry scent of cheap perfume lingered in the air long after she left.
